1.text: Man, born of woman, living for a short time, is filled with many miseries.

2.text: He comes forth like a flower, and is crushed, and he flees, as if a shadow, and never remains in the same state.

3.text: And do you consider it fitting to look down with your eyes on someone in this way and to lead him into judgment with you?

4.text: Who can make him clean who is conceived of unclean seed? Are you not the only one who can?

5.text: The days of man are short, and the number of his months is with you; you have determined his limits, which cannot be surpassed.

6.text: Withdraw a little from him, so that he may rest, until his awaited day arrives, like that of the hired hand.

7.text: A tree has hope: if it has been cut, it turns green again, and its branches spring forth.

8.text: If its roots grow old in the earth, and its trunk passes into dust,

9.text: at the scent of water, it will sprout and bring forth leaves, as when it had first been planted.

10.text: Truly, when a man dies, and has been left unprotected, and has decayed, I ask you where is he?

11.text: It is as if the waters had receded from the sea and an emptied river had dried up;

12.text: just so, when a man is fallen asleep, he will not rise again, until the heavens are worn away; he will not awaken, nor rise from his sleep.

13.text: Who will grant this to me, that you will protect me in the underworld, and hide me until your fury passes by, and establish a time for me, in which you will remember me?

14.text: Do you suppose that a dead man will live again? On each of the days in which I now battle, I wait until my transformation occurs.

15.text: You will call me and I will answer you; to the work of your hands, you will extend your right hand.

16.text: Indeed, you have numbered my steps, but you have been lenient with my sins.

17.text: You have sealed up my offenses, as if in a purse, but you have cured my iniquity.

18.text: A falling mountain flows away, and a stone is transferred from its place.

19.text: Waters wear away stones, and with a flood the land is reduced little by little; and similarly, you will destroy man.

20.text: You have strengthened him for a little while, so that he may cross over into eternity. You will change his face and send him forth.

21.text: Whether his sons have been noble or ignoble, he will not understand.

22.text: And in this way his body, while he yet lives, will have grief, and his soul will mourn over himself.
